results.t: SULK | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: Sep 4, 2024 — to be silent and unpleasant because you are angry or annoyed: She pouts and sulks, and she almost never smiles or laughs.
1. The state of one sulking; often used in plural; had a case of the sulks. 2. A sulky mood or spell in a sulk.
Sulk definition: to remain silent or hold oneself aloof in a sullen, ill-humored, or offended mood. See examples of SULK used in a sentence.

results.t: SULK Synonyms: 78 Similar and Opposite Words
results.p: Jul 26, 2024 — Synonyms for SULK: pouts, dumps, irritability, sulkiness, snit, sullenness, pet, blues; Antonyms of SULK: gaiety, cheerfulness, gayety, ...
When you are displeased by something and you let your gloomy mood show, you're sulking. Do you want to bake another cake, or are you going to sulk all day ...

results.t: SULK definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: If you sulk, you are silent and bad-tempered for a while because you are annoyed about something. He turned his back and sulked.

results.t: SULKING | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: Sep 4, 2024 — to be silent and refuse to smile or be pleasant to people because you are angry about something that they have done: He's sulking in his ...

results.t: sulk verb - Definition, pictures, pronunciation and usage ...
results.p: ​to look angry and refuse to speak or smile because you want people to know that you are upset about something. He went off to sulk in his room.
Listen to Sulk on Spotify. Song · Radiohead · 1995.
to be angry or upset about something and to refuse to discuss it with other people. He went to sulk in his room. She has been sulking all day.
Sep 4, 2024 — to be silent and unpleasant because you are angry or annoyed: She pouts and sulks, and she almost never smiles or laughs.
